body:
Comment 4: 
I don't see any evidence that it was resolved at tip. The issue is with binary releases,
which don't exist for 1.2 (yet) or tip (probably ever).

Attempting to build a binary release myself (using misc/dist/bindist.go) doesn't produce
a binary build that fails at either 1.1.2, or tip. Only the build downloadable from
golang.org doesn't work.

It may be the case that:
 a. The machine creating the binary package is doing something to cause the problem.
 b. Differences in the environment/toolchain between the build machine and my own (and others) is causing the problem

If it was possible to get my hands on a binary build of tip or a 1.2 release candidate
built by the "official" release machine (if one exists...) then I could tell you if the
situation still exists for me, otherwise we have to wait until after Go 1.2 is released
to see if the problem persists.
